content.p: The Curriculum and Assessment (Wales) Act 2021 (asc 4) is amended in accordance with this section.

After section 64 insert—Residential outdoor education
64AProvision of residential outdoor education(1)
The Welsh Ministers must take all reasonable steps to ensure that residential outdoor education is provided to registered pupils at maintained schools at least once before they cease being registered pupils at maintained schools.(2)
Those steps include the Welsh Ministers exercising their functions under this Act, and in particular—(a)
exercising functions under section 6 in order to make residential outdoor education a key concept within an area of learning and experience;(b)
exercising functions under section 71A to issue guidance in respect of residential outdoor education.(3)
The Welsh Ministers must issue a code (the Residential Outdoor Education Code) that sets out the way in which a curriculum is to make provision for residential outdoor education.(4)
The first Residential Outdoor Education Code must be issued within 1 year of this section coming into force.(5)
A curriculum does not comply with this Act unless it accords with the Residential Outdoor Education Code.(6)
The Welsh Ministers—(a)
must keep the Residential Outdoor Education Code under review, and(b)
may revise it.(7)
For further provision about the Residential Outdoor Education Code, see section 76.

After section 71 insert—
71ADuty to issue guidance in respect of residential outdoor education(1)
The Welsh Ministers must issue guidance under section 71 in respect of residential outdoor education.(2)
The first guidance must be issued within 1 year of this section coming into force.(3)
That guidance—(a)
must provide that residential outdoor education be comprised of at least 4 nights and 5 days stay in residential accommodation;(b)
may provide that this period of time be consecutive;(c)
may set out the age or ages, or school year or school years, at which residential outdoor education is to be provided;(d)
must provide that residential outdoor education is not compulsory for pupils to attend;(e)
may set requirements that must be satisfied before a person is permitted to provide residential outdoor education;(f)
may make provision in respect of the costs that it would be reasonable to incur in connection with residential outdoor education;(g)
may make provision in respect of staff costs for residential outdoor education;(h)
must provide that residential outdoor education is suitable to a pupil’s age, ability, aptitude and any additional learning needs;(i)
may make provision as to whether some residential outdoor education is to be provided in Welsh; and(j)
may include other provision that the Welsh Ministers consider appropriate.
in the heading, for The What Matters Code and the Progression Code substitute The What Matters Code, the Progression Code and the Residential Outdoor Education Code;

In section 83, in Table 1, insert at the appropriate place in alphabetical order—
Residential Outdoor Education Code
section 64A.

After section 64A of the Curriculum and Assessment (Wales) Act 2021 (asc 4) (as inserted by section 1 of this Act) insert—
64BFunding for residential outdoor education(1)
The Welsh Ministers must pay a local authority an amount sufficient to enable functions conferred by or under sections 64A and 71A, in respect of residential outdoor education, to be carried out.(2)
This section is without prejudice to Chapter 4 of Part 2 of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998 (c. 31) (financing of maintained schools).

After section 74 of the Curriculum and Assessment (Wales) Act 2021 (asc 4) insert—
Power to make transitional provision in respect of residential outdoor education
74A.—(1) The Welsh Ministers may by regulations make transitional provision in respect of the coming into force of sections 64A, 64B and 71A.(2)
Regulations made under subsection (1) may, in particular, modify or delay the coming into force of those sections in respect of different ages, or different school years, of registered pupils.
In section 75(2)(a) of the Curriculum and Assessment (Wales) Act 2021, for or 48 substitute , 48 or 74A.

content.p: basic Welsh user (“defnyddiwr Cymraeg sylfaenol”) has the meaning given in the Table in Schedule 1;

in relation to a pupil referral unit, “governing body” (“corff llywodraethu”) means the committee (if any) established to act as the management committee for the unit under regulations made under Schedule 1 to the Education Act 1996 and the teacher in charge of the unit;
independent Welsh user (“defnyddiwr Cymraeg annibynnol”) has the meaning given in the Table in Schedule 1;
local authority(“awdurdod lleol”) means a council of a county or county borough in Wales;

intro.p: maintained nursery school (“ysgol feithrin a gynhelir”) means a nursery school maintained by a local authority and that is not a special school;

proficient Welsh user (“defnyddiwr Cymraeg hyfedr”) has the meaning given in the Table in Schedule 1;
